intro: Neoporteria jussieui var. huascensis, commonly known as the Huascensis Neoporteria, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible or medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that appear in late summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough texture, which is a common trait among members of its family. This variety is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
